alert.note: Alert for Geneva; Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 8:46AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Henry, eastern Geneva and Houston Counties in southeastern Alabama, northwestern Jackson, northwestern Walton and Holmes Counties in the Panhandle of Florida, northwestern Miller, southeastern Clay, northwestern Baker, Calhoun and Early Counties in southwestern Georgia through 1045 AM EDT/945 AM CDT/... At 945 AM EDT/845 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles north of Columbia to Cowarts to near Geneva to 11 miles east of Crestview. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Colquitt, Cottonwood, Morgan, Blakely, Geneva, Graceville, Headland, Dothan, Hartford, Taylor, Kinsey, Ashford, Slocomb, Cowarts, Edison, Arlington, Webb, Columbia, Leary and Douglasville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
